title: Child Actor Regulations

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
House/ received bill from Legislative Research in Clerk of the House
House/ 1st reading (Introduced) in House Rules Committee
House/ received fiscal note from Fiscal Analyst in House Rules Committee
House/ to standing committee in House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee

general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to minors involved in entertainment.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a parent or guardian establish a trust for a performer;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which a parent or guardian may serve as the trustee of a performer's trust;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for a performer's employer when depositing a percentage of the performer's earnings into a trust;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a right of action for a performer;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a content creator maintain a monthly record that relates to a minor involved in the content creator's content;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a content creator maintain the monthly records for at least one year;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a content creator inform a minor's parents that the minor is featured in the content creator's content;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a minor's parent or guardian establish a trust for the minor featured in social media content;<hr><ltbullet>establishes limitations related to the trust established for a minor featured in social media content;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a formula for a content creator to calculate the percentage of any earnings from social media that feature a minor and to transfer the earnings to the minor's trust;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a right of action for an individual featured in social media content as a minor;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process by which a content creator may petition a court for an exception to the requirement to divide earnings from social media featuring a minor;<hr><ltbullet>grants an individual featured in social media content as a minor a right of deletion;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a social media company maintain a readily available process by which an individual featured in social media content as a minor may request that a social media company delete content featuring the individual featured in social media content as a minor; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a process by which a social media company may petition a court to maintain social media content an individual requests that the social media company delete.
last_action_owner: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
